channel.title: I need a little help read more for details.!
channel.description:
[b]ok[/b], im using project 16 v.6 edit 8 but i want to be able to remove some objects and add objects but i can not figur out how to do it, can someone please help :confused: - thanks -
ok season scape has helped me all the way so far but ive had no reply from him on the last reply i left so can some1 help me finish it ta unless season scape comes bk on and helps

item.title: I need a little help read more for details.!

client.java:2445: ReplaceObject2(int,int,int,int,int) is already defined in clie nt public void ReplaceObject2(int objectX, int objectY, int NewObjectID, in t Face, int ObjectType) { ^ client.java:287: unexpected type required: variable found : value if(person.distanceToPoint(x, y) = 60){ ^ client.java:318: cannot find symbol symbol : method AddGlobalObject(int,int,int,int,int) location: class client AddGlobalObject(3004, 3383, 2469, 0, 10);//portal ^ Note: stream.java uses or overrides a deprecated API. Note: Recompile with -Xlint:deprecation for details. 3 errors Press any key to continue . . .

item.description:
@bluefire999 wrote:

[quote=“Season-Scape, post:5, topic:192927”]first find

public void NewObjects() {

under that u should see something like this

makeGlobalObject(####x, ####y, ####, #, 10); // ####x, ####y =  cords for your object (were you want to put it)

#= FACE: 0= WEST | -1 = NORTH | -2 = EAST | -3 = SOUTH

= object id[/quote]

yh here is the problem i cant find public void NewObjects in ma client file :S

item.title: I need a little help read more for details.!
item.dc:creator: @bluefire999 bluefire999
item.description:
@bluefire999 wrote:

[quote=“letspkemscape, post:3, topic:192927”]1st. if you have a goh stands for (globalobjecthandler), search in your files if you dont have it, open up your client.java and search for “GlobalObject” , make sure the “G” and “O” is capitals and when you find it add something like this…

   example::  makeGlobalObject(Xcords, Ycords, ObjectId, -1, 10);//tree

2nd to add an npc, go to your autospawn and it should look something like this…

( //------NpcID---XCor----Ycor--Height--RangeX1-RangeY1-RangeX2-RangeY2-WalkType-Description)  that should look something like that at the top now to add an npc here is my example (make sure you have those cords and range stuff at the top), now put something under it like this...
                 ( npcid)     (Xcords)   (Ycords)  Ycor--Height--RangeX1-RangeY1-RangeX2-RangeY2
      spawn = 1615	3079	3825	0	0	0	0	0

there i hope this helped you and good luck

letspkemscape.[/quote]

thanks for that i looked about i didnt have a globalobjecthandler and when i looked in client all i foun was this.

[code] public void SpawnWorldObjects() {
for (int i = 0; i < server.worldObject.WorldObjectCount; i++) {
if (heightLevel == server.worldObject.ObjectHeight[i]) {
placeGlobalObject(server.worldObject.ObjectX[i], server.worldObject.ObjectY[i], server.worldObject.ObjectID[i], server.worldObject.Orientation[i], server.worldObject.TileObjectType[i]);
} else {
}
}
}
/* 0 = West || -1 = North || -2 = East || -3 = South /
/ tileObjectType: 0-3 wall objects, 4-8 wall decoration, 9: diag. walls, 10-11 world objects, 12-21: roofs, 22: floor decoration */
public void placeObject(int objectX, int objectY, int NewObjectID, int Face, int ObjectType) {
outStream.createFrame(85);
outStream.writeByteC(objectY - (mapRegionY * 8));
outStream.writeByteC(objectX - (mapRegionX * 8));

	outStream.createFrame(101);
	outStream.writeByteC((ObjectType<<2) + (Face&3));
	outStream.writeByte(0);

	if (NewObjectID != -1) {
		outStream.createFrame(151);
		outStream.writeByteS(0);
		outStream.writeWordBigEndian(NewObjectID);
		outStream.writeByteS((ObjectType<<2) + (Face&3));
	}</a>
}
public void placeGlobalObject(int objectX, int objectY, int NewObjectID, int Face, int ObjectType) {
	for (Player p : server.playerHandler.players) {
		if(p != null) {
			client person = (client)p;
			if((person.playerName != null || person.playerName != "null")) {
				if(person.distanceToPoint(objectX, objectY) <= 60) {
					person.placeObject(objectX, objectY, NewObjectID, Face, ObjectType);
				}
			}
		}
	}
}

[/code]

i looked in my worldobject but nothink, so yh im not sure how to

Read full topic

item.title: I need a little help read more for details.!
item.dc:creator: @letspkemscape letspkemscape
item.description:
@letspkemscape wrote:

1st. if you have a goh stands for (globalobjecthandler), search in your files if you dont have it, open up your client.java and search for “GlobalObject” , make sure the “G” and “O” is capitals and when you find it add something like this…

   example::  makeGlobalObject(Xcords, Ycords, ObjectId, -1, 10);//tree

2nd to add an npc, go to your autospawn and it should look something like this…

( //------NpcID---XCor----Ycor--Height--RangeX1-RangeY1-RangeX2-RangeY2-WalkType-Description)  that should look something like that at the top now to add an npc here is my example (make sure you have those cords and range stuff at the top), now put something under it like this...
                 ( npcid)     (Xcords)   (Ycords)  Ycor--Height--RangeX1-RangeY1-RangeX2-RangeY2
      spawn = 1615	3079	3825	0	0	0	0	0

there i hope this helped you and good luck

letspkemscape.

Read full topic
